wiki_summary_en : Fort 50 ¬Ω O Kosocice ‚Äì one of the forts of the Krak√≥w Fortress. It was built between 1897 and 1899. In 1945, it was stripped of its towers ‚Äì both armored and observation. It belonged to the VII fortified area. The object was designed by Emil Go≈Çog√≥rski. 

It defended the railway line to Przemy≈õl and the Lw√≥w Route. In December 1914, the fort, along with the neighboring forts 50 "Prokocim" and 51 "Rajsko," held back the main force of the Russian assault on Krak√≥w. The fort is in good condition and is occasionally open to visitors. It is part of the Krak√≥w Fortress Museum. The object is located at J. Hallera Street in Krak√≥w.

wiki_summary_en : Kowadza (261 m) ‚Äì a hill in Tyniec in Krak√≥w. Administratively, it belongs to District VIII Dƒôbniki. Geographically, it is part of the Tyniec Hills on the Krak√≥w Bridge within the macroregion of the Krak√≥w Gate. These hills have been included in the area of the Biela≈Ñsko-Tyniecki Landscape Park.  
Kowadza rises on the eastern side of ≈öwiƒôtoja≈Ñska Street in Tyniec. Formed from limestone, the hill is mostly covered by a beech-hornbeam forest, but the summit and southern slopes are open fields of former pastures and meadows. It is covered by a thin layer of soil with xerothermic grassland. Thanks to the open areas, the summit of Kowadza is a good viewpoint. In the valley lies Uroczysko Tyniec, to the southwest the horizon is obscured by the hills of Wielkanoc and Bogucianka, to the south Guminek, and just to the east is the hill Du≈ºa Kowodrza.  
An ecological site named Uroczysko Kowadza, covering an area of 10 ha, has been established on Kowadza. Benches, trash bins, tourist information boards, and a shelter have been prepared for tourists. A marked hiking trail runs over the summit of Kowadza, with educational paths along its slopes.

answer:
**Good Lood** (the ice cream shop) has **three locations in Krak√≥w**, each with slightly different opening hours on **Saturdays**. Based on the context data, here‚Äôs the relevant information for your question:

### **Good Lood Opening Hours on Saturdays**:
1. **Tadeusza Romanowicza Street** (Podg√≥rze/Zab≈Çocie area)
   - **Hours**: **11:00‚Äì21:00** (Mo‚ÄìSu)
   - *Note*: Same hours every day, including Saturdays.
   - üìç [Map Location](https://www.google.com/maps/place/50.0475033,19.9640347)
   - üç¶ Takeaway: **Yes** | ü¶Ω Wheelchair: **Yes**

2. **Boles≈Çawa Orli≈Ñskiego Street** (Near Krak√≥w Airport/Balice)
   - **Hours**: **10:00‚Äì21:00** (Sa‚ÄìSu)
   - *Note*: Opens earlier on weekends (10 AM vs. 11 AM on weekdays).
   - üìç [Map Location](https://www.google.com/maps/place/50.0817384,19.9996506)
   - üç¶ Takeaway: **No** | ü¶Ω Wheelchair: **Yes**

3. **Aleja Pu≈Çkownika Beliny-Pra≈ºmowskiego** (Near Blonia Park)
   - **Hours**: **11:00‚Äì21:00** (Saturday)
   - *Note*: Closes 30 mins earlier on weekdays (Mon‚ÄìFri until 20:30).
   - üìç [Map Location](https://www.google.com/maps/place/50.0686213,19.9597106)
   - üç¶ Takeaway: **Yes** | ü¶Ω Wheelchair: **No**

---
### **Recommendation**:
- If you‚Äôre near **Podg√≥rze/Zab≈Çocie** (e.g., visiting Schindler‚Äôs Factory or MOCAK), the **Romanowicza location** is open until 9 PM.
- For **early access (10 AM)**, head to the **Orli≈Ñskiego** spot (near the airport).
- The **Beliny-Pra≈ºmowskiego** location (close to the city center) is ideal if you‚Äôre exploring **Blonia Park** or **Wawel**.

üí° **Pro Tip**: Check their [website](https://goodlood.com) for seasonal updates or special events! Their artisanal ice cream (with vegan options) is a must-try in Krak√≥w.
